definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: North Korea also prohibited reunions between North and South Korean families.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮作爲報復停止了讓朝鮮和韓國失散家庭團聚。

sentences.english: He discovers ancient temples with long lost treasures and menacing traps.
sentences.chinese: 他發現與失散多年的珍品和險惡陷阱古剎。

sentences.english: How can there be love if we are separated as you try to philosophize earlier.
sentences.chinese: 如何纔能有愛，如果我們失散的嘗試哲學較早。

sentences.english: His family was severed in the war.
sentences.chinese: 他的家人在戰爭中失散了。

sentences.english: The searchers fanned out to look for the missing child.
sentences.chinese: 搜索的人們爲了尋找失散的小孩，呈扇形散開。

sentences.english: After much effort, he finally found the relatives he'd lost touch with for many years.
sentences.chinese: 幾經周折，他終於找到了失散多年的親人。

sentences.english: Everyone is in the street in front of their houses. They are trying to find family members.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都呆在屋前的街道到，焦急的找尋失散的家人。

sentences.english: As the days whizzed by, I felt worried about the long-lost brother.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間的逝去，我對我失散的兄弟感到擔憂。

sentences.english: There was a picture enclosed, my first sight of my lost child.
sentences.chinese: 裏面有張照片，第一次我看到失散多年的兒子。

sentences.english: Imagine the joyful scene when they were reunited with their lost daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他們與失散的女兒團聚，快樂的情景是可想然而知的。

sentences.english: My greatest joy this year was getting back in touch with friends I had lost touch with over the years.
sentences.chinese: 去年最高興的事，是找到了失散多年的親人。

sentences.english: The mother couldn't wait to see her long-lost son.
sentences.chinese: 母親急不可待地要見她失散多年的兒子。

sentences.english: We finally tracked down our lost companion in a public house.
sentences.chinese: 我們終於在一家酒館裏找到了我們失散的夥伴。

sentences.english: And even if one wanted to reunite dispersed works of art, where would one do so?
sentences.chinese: 即使想讓失散的藝術品重新團聚，該在哪裏團聚呢？

sentences.english: I’d oversleep and lose my flock.
sentences.chinese: 也許我會睡過頭醒來後發現羊羣早已失散。

sentences.english: With tears of joy, he enfolded his long-lost daughter in his arms.
sentences.chinese: 他熱盈眶，緊緊地抱住失散多年的女兒。

definition: to wander off/to stray/to get lost
to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
to wander about destitute/to be stranded
